title: Learning-based Grasping of Grocery Items using Caging-inspired Gripper Design
description: Developed machine learning methods for grasping groceries, and applied them extensively on real hardware. Achieved state of the art performance, 18% improvement on a bin picking benchmark by Ocado, 11% median grocery grasping improvement vs related work.

title: Reinforcement Learning Grasping with Force Feedback from Modeling Compliant Fingers
description: Trained grasping in simulation using reinforcement learning, with 95.0% success rate on 42 grocery objects.

title: Evaluating a Movable Palm using a Reinforcement Learning-based Approach
description: Learned and analysed optimal design parameters by training a variety of grasping controllers.

title: Reinforcement learning-based Grasping via Affordance Localization
description: System integration of grasping, affordance localisation, and CLIP object identification.

title: A Caging-inspired Gripper using Flexible Fingers and a Movable Palm
description: Presented a novel gripper design and proof of concept for stable grasping.

title: Flexure Couplings for Precision Control of Automated Robotic Mechanisms
description: Developed a mathematical model for a flexure robot, and modelled it in MATLAB using numerical techniques.

title: Programming a Chess Engine using C++, Python, and learning
description: Developed a traditional chess engine capable of beating me in C++, to be compiled into Python. Then, I applied deep learning to optimise the evaluation function.

title: Designing and Building 13 Different Puzzle Boxes
description: Designed and built 13 puzzle boxes on my own using a 3D printer, which are all opened with different mechanisms. The gif shows the final section of the 50 move solution.
